lines.text: I was laid off for turning down a stag affair in Passaic.
Well, I don't blame ya. We've still got a little pride left. You're not so low you have to let 'em throw pennies at ya!
Throw 'em? In Passaic, they use slinghots.
Violet got a Marine's name tattooed on her arm last night.
By this time, that arm must read like a regimental roll call.
If you're waiting for Gladys to stake you to a trip to Havana, save your breath. She wouldn't give you a nickel to go out and see the Statue of Liberty do a nip-up.
Well, I guess we better go home. I feel like a horse's neck.
Yeah-I feel like the rest of the animal.
Timberg wants to see you in the office, Mae. What've you done this time?
Maybe last Easter I forgot to give him a bunny? Who knows?
Hey, hey! How come I only got 15 this week?
You're fined 5 bucks.
For what?
Tuesday matinee, all during the Honolulu number, you were scratching your back with your hand.
What was I supposed to use? A nutmeg grater?
Tomorrow night, after the show, I'm sending you over to Passaic - to a smoker.
What's the idea?
I want you to go over there and make 'em sit up.
Not me. Better get yourself an animal trainer.
I want you to do a dance. You know, show 'em somthin'.
Is it a benefit?
Yeah, it's a benefit.
Then I'm out. My conscious wouldn't let me. What I'd show 'em, wouldn't benefit any of 'em.
Now, listen, is it gonna hurt you to go over there tomorrow night and shake it up a little fer 'em?
Say, listen, when I finish here at midnight, after nine shows a day, I can't even shake my little finger.
I was fined five bucks for foolin' around with eczema.
Who's he?
That's an itch.
I can't stay very long. My limousine and chauffeur are waiting. I thought I'd drop in to say ta-ta.
Did you hit oil or something?
My dears, I've been to Cuba! Havana. Don't my skin look tan?
Tanned? I'd say it was embossed.
What'd you do in Cuba, run the mint?
Well, not exactly. But, I had it worried for a little while.
Oh, come on, tell us, did you marry a millionaire?
No, but, I've been kicking around with about 15 or 20.
Think of being knee deep in millionaires.
I can't, I get dizzy.
Dears, I'm telling you the place is positively reeking with them. The suckers!
Give us the dope, will ya? I'm beginning to think our education's been neglected.
How's he work it?
Breech of promise! I met a Mr. Monahan, a steel man. He'd a married me, only his wife objected.
Wives are funny that way.
How long will it take you to pack?
Why?
We're going to Havana while the gold rush is on.
If a dumb cluck like her can go and make good, a couple of smart dames like us can take over the joint.
Oh, yeah?

Well, we got to do something! We're getting older all the time. We've got to go to Havana and start putting money in the bank. If we don't, in two or three years where are we going to be? Right behind the eight ball.
The seven ball, there's no more room behind the eight ball.
Fifteen hundred bucks! Your old lady must have got her gall stones at Tiffany's.

[Calling on the phone]
Hello, honey! This is Herman. How does that make you feel?

[Sarcastically]
Pink and panting. What's on your mind besides your hat?
Oh, Herman, you're the sweetest thing that ever put on yellow button shoes.
Sadie! Sadie! There's a man in our bedroom.
Didn't I tell you our luck would change.
Now, don't clown. Maybe we're in the wrong room.
I'll tell you about that when I take a gander at the guy.
[Walks into the bedroom and sees Deacon R. Jones in the bed]
Has he got his knees raised up or is all that his stomach?
How many times do I have to tell you, always find out who a guy is before you sock 'em.

[Drunken toast]
Here's water in your cellar.
I hope you don't mind Dad leaving me in his place?
Mind? I could do nip-ups.
That's an idea, how 'bout a dance?
Have you seen our moonlight?
No. Have you got some?
Sure. Wanna see it?
I'll try anything once. That's my undoing.
Something tells me, I'm just what the doctor ordered for you.
Well, I may need something - but you're not the prescription.
[Deep kiss]
Oh, you are what the doctor ordered!
Mrs. Ryan, do you by any chance know Mae's address in Kansas?
Kansas? Sure, she never went to Kansas.
She didn't? Where did she go?
Her and Sadie went to Havana.
Havana? What state's that in?
No state. It's an island. A hunk of land sitting in the middle of the ocean.
Sadie, was his eyes blue or gray?
Who?
Young Jones. Who do you think I mean? Santa Claus?
How would you like to put that pink little body of yours into a Havana hoosegow?
Could they really slap us in the cooler?
I know it! Duffy said so. What's more, with that husky build of yours, you're liable to be shoved right on a road gang.

[On the phone]
Hello! Duffy speaking. Duffy, the queen of the Maine. Ha-ha-ha.
Miss Appleby, if his nibs and Mae are ready, we'll all sneak in and take a little peak.
No-no! No, you can't go in there. She's convalescing.
Well, she can stop for a few seconds! I gotta talk to her.
Butch is in town. He followed me over here and he wants his dough. If I ain't got it - I'm a cinch to be rubbed out.
You're kidding!
I wish I was.
I don't want Butch to spoil my lily white body with a 45 automatic.

[Practicing a frame-up]
At last I have found you in the arms of my husband.
Wife! You nitwit! Will you ever get it straight!
Well, I don't like to boast; but, it looks like everything is going to be hunky dory!
Now, if he's cold at first, don't get discouraged. Remember, Nero played a fiddle while Rome burned.
He better act fast because I'm not gonna burn long enough for him to do much fiddlin'.
Why? Miss Knight, what are you doing in here?
You big bag of muscles, you!
Oh, help! Help! Help! Help! Help!
Well, kick my shins from ear to ear.
Just thought I'd drop in to say ta-ta.
Say, ain't it funny - only yesterday I was sayin' to Mae...
Yeah, yeah, we was wonderin' who you was... whatcha was doin'.
Ain't the... aren't you the dears.
Well, let me drive you. All you have to do is to get in, tell me where to go.
Oh, I don't have to get in to tell you that!
